English (United States)(en-US): If only I could tell Red that it’s all real.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드에게 정말로 존재한다고 말해 주고파.

English (United States)(en-US): That my chances live\nand breathe somewhere.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 가능성이 어딘가에서 살아 숨쉬고 있다고.

English (United States)(en-US): That dreams soar among clouds,\nmelt through frost.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈꾸며 구름 속을 비행하려 한다고,\n꿈꾸며 성에를 녹이려 한다고.

English (United States)(en-US): So I am a dream who dreams.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러면 나는 꿈을 꾸는 꿈.

English (United States)(en-US): For that someone who\nwill want me as their dream…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 ‘꿈’으로 삼아 줄 사람을 위해서…

English (United States)(en-US): I can dream of being a dream!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 꿈이 되는 꿈을 꿀 수 있다고!

English (United States)(en-US): Even if Ring Boy didn’t\nsee himself in the mirror
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 반지 소년이 거울에 비치지 않아도

English (United States)(en-US): or couldn’t press his hand\nto his empty cheek
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 손바닥을 빈 뺨에 가져다 댈 수 없어도

English (United States)(en-US): his emptiness would have swallowed\neverything beyond the stone wall.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 허점은 담 너머에 있는 모든 것을 빨아들였을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): This boy that searches his pockets\nand soldiers on is the same.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 주머니를 더듬으며\n끝없이 나아가는 이 문학 소년도 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): A steam train that runs forever,\npowered by the unknown.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 소년은 정체 모를 연료로\n무한히 달려가는 기관차야.

English (United States)(en-US): You experience conflict and\ncontrast within yourselves.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너희는 너희 혼자서도\n상반과 대비를 겪을 수 있구나.

English (United States)(en-US): … Yet accept it all as ‘yourself?’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼에도 모든 걸 ‘나’라고\n품을 수가 있는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): The contradictory human mind.\nTruly beautiful.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모순된 너희 인간은... 정말로 아름다워.

English (United States)(en-US): In all my monochrome memories\nof the Moon, there’s music.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에서의 흑백 기억 속엔\n늘 음악이 깔려 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s the voice of Sir Cello,\none which I’ll never hear again.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다시는 직접 들을 수 없는\n첼로 경의 목소리야.

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps the cello melodies that\nfilled my little Moon to the brim
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 작은 달나라를 울리던 첼로 선율이

English (United States)(en-US): are destined to fade away into\nEarth’s beautiful, vivid racket.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지구의 아름답고 생동감 넘치는\n소음들과 뒤섞이면서 희석될지라도

English (United States)(en-US): But I’ll always be here, on Earth,\ntrying my bestest to hold onto
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 지구에서, 달의 흰빛 소리들을\n온 힘 다해 기억할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): the Moon’s pearly sound—\nthat dear, forever-lost hum.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다시 보고 들을 수 없기에\n그만큼 귀중한 소리를.

English (United States)(en-US): 수정되어야 함
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 수정되어야 함

English (United States)(en-US): Without you, my corner would’ve\nbeen impossibly forlorn.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>…. 정말로 네가 없는\n모퉁이는 얼마나 적막했을까.

English (United States)(en-US): Two can stick together, truly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말, 정말로 둘이라면\n뭉칠 수 있는 거였는데.

English (United States)(en-US): I feel ashamed not to have known that…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 미처 몰랐던 내가 너무 부끄러워…

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll start over. Then you answer me\nwith “That’s how it is.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 다시 해 볼게. 그럼 너는\n‘그렇고 말고’하고 대답해 주는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Okay? Okay…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 준비됐어? 간다…

English (United States)(en-US): Us two can stick together!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리 둘이라면 뭉칠 수 있어!

English (United States)(en-US): An empty cave that\nfollows the Hour of Lead…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 납의 시간 뒤에 찾아오는 텅 빈 동굴...

English (United States)(en-US): Quartz contentment grows\nregardless in that desolate space.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 공허한 자리에 자라나는 게\n무심한 석영.

English (United States)(en-US): Not a pearl-filled box or a tree\ndecorated with colorful garlands.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 진주가 든 상자도, 색색깔 가랜드로\n장식된 축제 트리도 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): She lived. That’s all there\nwas to it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 살아 남았어. 단지 그뿐이겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): But perhaps sometimes\nit’s enough to remember.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 기억한다는 걸로\n충분한 것도 있는 모양이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Ever tried a lemon\npreserved in sugar?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 설탕에 절인 레몬을\n먹어 본 적 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): I pictured the taste. Hmm, aren’t\nlemons refreshing enough as they are?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 상상해 봤어. 음, 절이지 않아도\n충분히 상큼하지 않으려나?

English (United States)(en-US): A bumpy kind of yellow.\nA collection of water drops.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오돌토돌한 샛노랑.\n투명한 물방울들의 집합.

English (United States)(en-US): Starting a club for those that\neat lemons raw might be nice.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레몬을 생으로 먹는 모임이라도\n만들면 좋지 않으려나.

English (United States)(en-US): I’d like to share this poem\nwith those humans.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 인간들에게\n들려 주고 싶은 시야.

English (United States)(en-US): To today’s boy…\nsurely in this world
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘의 소년에게도… 이 세상에는 분명

English (United States)(en-US): there is a place for him.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 자리가 있을 테니까.

English (United States)(en-US): I could not use my body\nto wipe a rain-stained glass.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 비 내리는 유리창에\n내 끈적한 몸을 닦을 순 없을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): It would leave a thick smear,\none like my old friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼 나의 옛 친구를 닮은\n진득한 흔적이 남겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): I’d wipe and wipe and still\nbe better off where I’d been.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 닦아도 닦아도\n닦지 않으니만 못해지겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): Which is why I won’t\nwipe the glass in solitude.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까 난 홀로 유리창을 닦지 않을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): …… I hope my mold friend
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 곰팡이 친구가...

English (United States)(en-US): does not appear on my glass.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 창에 떠오르지 않았으면 좋겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): One gloomy night, while I\npeered, mushy and inky
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어느 음울한 한밤중, 물렁하고 색짙은 몸으로

English (United States)(en-US): Into many a peculiar and strange\ndream of intimate stories—
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내밀한 이야기들이 담긴\n기이하고 이상한 꿈을 보다

English (United States)(en-US): While I nodded, nearly napping,\nsuddenly there came a tapping.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 선잠에 든 채 꾸벅거리는 중,\n갑작스레 두드리는 소리가 들렸어.

English (United States)(en-US): “’Tis some visitor—\nOnly this and nothing more.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “방문객이로군.” “그저 방문객일 뿐,\n아무것도 아닐 거야.”

English (United States)(en-US): I asked the small bird three questions.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 작은 새에게 나는 세 가지 질문을 했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Is there a future\nwhere I do not disappear?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그곳에는 내가\n소멸하지 않는 미래가 있는가?

English (United States)(en-US): Will I once again see\nthese beautiful humans?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 또는 아름다운 인간과\n다시금 만날 수는 있는가?

English (United States)(en-US): If not, could I forget\neverything about them?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니라면 나는 인간에 대한\n모든 걸 잊을 수 없는가?

English (United States)(en-US): Nevermore, nevermore, nevermore.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 절대로, 절대로, 절대로.

English (United States)(en-US): If those are your only answers,\nI’d rather you remain a beakless bird.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리 답할 바에야\n차라리 부리 없는 새로 남아.

English (United States)(en-US): Still, the reason I can’t seem\nto stop these questions…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래도, 나로 하여금,\n질문을 멈출 수 없는 이유는…

English (United States)(en-US): What is the reason the speaker\ncan’t seem to stop? I’d like your thoughts.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 화자가 멈출 수 없는 이유는 뭘까?\n네 생각이 궁금해.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>. <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>. <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Can’t I, with my stickiness,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 끈끈한 몸으로\n무자비한 시간을 부둥켜 안은 채

English (United States)(en-US): cling to time and its cruelties
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 단 한 알이라도, 단 한 알이라도

English (United States)(en-US): and a single, a singular grain?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 붙잡아 볼 수는 없는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): Can’t I, un-buffeted,\nremain in this world
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 단 한 톨의 ‘뭉치’라도 좋으니\n떠밀리지 않고

English (United States)(en-US): even as a single speck of ‘Dot’?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 세상에 남아 있을 수는 없을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Have dreams and hopes
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈은, 희망은,

English (United States)(en-US): truly vanished—no. Wrong question.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 사라진…. 아, 아니지.\n질문이 틀렸구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Were they never there to begin with?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 처음부터 존재하지 않았던 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>. <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>. <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Do you think I know how to slip\nbeneath the surface on the well of grief?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 충분히 우물 속에\n잠길 줄 아는 괴물인 것 같아?

English (United States)(en-US): I hope you think so.\nIt’s a side of myself I cherish.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 봐 주면 좋겠어.\n난 나의 그런 모습을 아끼거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Look. My queries—ones like burnt ash.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이걸 봐. 나의 타고 남은 재 같은 의문들을

English (United States)(en-US): Now put into words far more\nbrilliant than mine.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나보다도 더 멋진 언어로\n그린 이들이 있다는 걸 알게 되었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I feel nestled into a movement\nfar bigger than myself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 거대하고도 거대한 흐름 속에\n감싸인 기분이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Not like inside a damp cup,\nbut my own snug hole
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눅눅한 머그컵 속은 아니고,\n빛무리가 튀는 여름 해변의 모래에

English (United States)(en-US): on a summer beach where\nlight scatters off the sand.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 자리에 그 구덩이에\n알맞게 비워진 나의 공간에 들어온 느낌.

English (United States)(en-US): So at long last will\nmy mind begin to wonder—
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 나는 이제부터서야\n한가로운 고민을 할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): What verse will I leave behind?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 시를 바치면 할까?

English (United States)(en-US): What verse should I leave behind?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 시를 바쳐야 좋을까?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 함께해 줘.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 어떤 시를 바치고 싶어?
